sub_title: Building community to transform financial systems to recognize true value
summary:
I am on the mission to inspire and empower people to make the world healthier and more sustainable by building engaging communities. 🤝🌎🌱 

As a global citizen from Taiwan and have been lived in 3 continents and 8 countries, I’m wired for connection and intrigued by the collective goods people can achieve together. In my free time I do yoga & acrobatic, spend time with friends and family, and travel extensively. Meeting people around the world makes me feel humble and energized to keep nudging for a more sustainable and inclusive world.

Having the privilege to meet many inspiring leaders and mentors who walk the talks and lead by examples, I believe that motivation and inspiration bring up the best in people. I’m building the sustainability community by inspiring people with stories and knowledge and getting people together to call deep down in their courage to create the impacts we want for our future.

I am also an active member of the Philips’ #bethechange network, driving sustainability initiatives across the organization and supporting inclusion and diversity movement bottom up. 

This year I am representing Philips as 1 of the 3 representatives globally to attend the Nudge Global Impact Challenge, developing an impact plan that contributes to sustainability. I also spoke at events and panels such as at the 2019 Philips International Women’s Day event and #SustainabilityTalk.

<Sustainability at Philips>
Philips is a clear frontrunner in sustainability and our achievement is increasing recognized by investors, customers, supply chain partners, and talents seeking to work with us. To stay on track of our ambitions, however, we need everyone at Philips to drive our sustainability collectively. If we can further align the personal passions and purpose of our colleagues with our company purpose, we can be a tremendously strong force for impact. 

That's why we are engaging our sustainability community not only by encouraging voluntary work towards sustainability but more importantly, embedding sustainability into everything we do!

company.name: WBCSD – World Business Council for Sustainable Development

profile_positions.company: WBCSD – World Business Council for Sustainable Development
profile_positions.title: Community Manager, Redefining Value

profile_positions.description:
As the Sustainability Community Manager, I am driving engagement and activation of global Philips employees for collective efforts for our Sustainability ambitions. We are doing so by amplifying our sustainability vision and mission throughout the company via our thriving sustainability Community of Practice while building a core network of ambassadors who role model by their sustainability leadership and help translate ambitions and challenges into everyday decision making.  

My current priorities are:
>> Shaping the overall communication and engagement strategy of Group sustainability with target stakeholder groups, such as Public Affairs, Experience Design, and Global Employee Engagement. 
>> Partnering with sustainability experts to initiate and deploy a steady stream of stories, case studies, activation events throughout Philips from the sustainability community of practice, of which I grew the number of members from 3000+ to the tipping point of 10% of population of more than 8000 members.
>> Managing the Sustainability Community of Practice by working directly with 10+ sustainability topic Moderators to ensure knowledge management, best practice sharing, thriving discussion on challenges and latest news
>> Increasing Sustainability Ambassadors globally by building the Philips Sustainability Ambassador Development Program with the first pilot of 20 spots of global ambassadors, mentored and coached by senior leaders 
>> Driving towards a thriving Community of Practice where information and knowledge of focal areas of Sustainability is saved, shared, and facilitated. 
>> Raising awareness by sharing stories and best practices and planning a steady stream of FUN and INSPIRING activities!
profile_positions.title: Sustainability Community Manager

profile_positions.description:
#bethec​hange is a global movement for future-minded Philips employees who want to drive meaningful changes.
​
We enable colleagues to be the change they want to see by unlocking their potentials and connecting and collaborating cross-functions and geography. 

I am a core team member of Drive sustainable impact.
profile_positions.title: Change Maker @ #bethechange Drive Sustainable Impact

profile_positions.description:
Leading and growing IT’s signature proposition to early career talents – the Philips Business & IT Traineeship program. Through this program we attract digital native top talents to step into an accelerated career in Philips Information Technology to secure our position to improve lives of billions people through meaningful innovation.

I am responsible for optimal the development of top talents and create a strong and engaging talent communities (trainees, graduates, and interns) for the future success of Philips IT. To achieve this I am the linking pin between the IT Leadership strategies and talent projects executions. My main stakeholders include IT Leadership Team, HR BP, HR Managers, Learning & Development experts, Recruitment team, universities, local assignment managers, and of course, trainees, graduates and interns of IT.
profile_positions.title: Business & IT Traineeship Program Manager

profile_positions.description:
Recruiting young talents to join the healthcare journey of Philips with the best-in-class candidate experiences. Sharing inspiration and business knowledge from Philips by strategically planning campus events and activities. Coaching and mentoring Philips interns coming from various nationalities and backgrounds for meaningful and inspiring internship experience. Managing relationship with business partners, including hiring managers and senior decision makers, to create talents pipeline and successful conversion via campus recruitment. 

> High customer satisfaction, NPS scored 88% (averaged from both Hiring Managers and Candidates); awarded as 1 of the 2 Best Candidate NPS recruiters in BNL with 91%. 
> Plan and execute 60+ campus events and intern events E2E (end-to-end), including highlights: 
o	2 Keynote Speeches from CEO, Frans van Houten “The key trends that are transforming healthcare forever” and "Strategy and Purpose" &  Global Director Inclusion & Diversity, Astrid Balsink “Inclusion and Diversity”
o	Case Workshops for students to understand Philips better with business cases built from scratch.
o	Philips Intern activities, such as Volunteering Day in collaboration with Philips Foundation, Philips Traineeship info sessions, Workshop for networking & career planning, Cooking at Philips Kitchen.
•	Collaborate with Recruitment Marketing on various projects, including Career Online QA, LinkedIn article, Vlog, influencer marketing. 
•	Leading “Intern Experience Mapping” project to create a smooth and engaging internship experience at Philips Netherlands (600+ annual intern hires across 5 offices) from Discovery stage to Conversion as full-time hires.
•	Acted as Candidate Experience Ambassador, responsible of EMEA Campus Job Ad template, job ad training, NPS and feedback analysis, implementation of Workday Pre-defined questionnaires.
profile_positions.title: Campus Recruiter

profile_positions.title: SDGs Alumni Ambassador

profile_positions.description:
As one of the company delegates at the Nudge Global Impact Challenge, I am rolling out my impact plan about empowering colleagues to act on sustainability through building community and an ambassador program.

Nudge Global Impact Challenge is an unique leadership program that nudges 90 young professionals from around the world every year about Sustainability, Leadership, and Impact: https://www.nudgeglobalimpactchallenge.com/
profile_positions.title: Company Delegate

company.name: CEMS - The Global Alliance in Management Education

profile_positions.company: CEMS - The Global Alliance in Management Education
profile_positions.description:
Built a network that connects CEMS alumni with the global CEMS alliance- reps from 31 business schools in 6 continents, over 75 multinational Corporations and Social Partners/ NGOs, through volunteer engagement, event/ meetings organization, and partnership development. Was in charge of communication, branding and partnership building, internally and externally, to increases synergies and opportunities. Conduct data and marketing analytics to understand customers experience and execute digital marketing and communication plans.

>> Manage alumni brand & communications to increase engagement. Responsibilities include oversight of social media activities, creation of marketing materials (copywriting, newsletters, presentation, brochure), website content, agency liaison, and making presentation at conferences and events.

>> Oversee volunteering programs of over 250 volunteers reps from 40+ countries for network outreach, community building, and partnership with in/ external stakeholders. The biggest campaign “Global Alumni Week” achieved close to 50 events across 25 countries in a week in 2018.

>> Coordinate logistics and execute high-profile local, regional and global meetings and events. Such as the CEMS Annual Events, the biggest event of the year, rotating to different country annually with over 2,500 participants from 50+ countries joining for governance meetings, social and formal events, including General Assembly and Graduation Ceremony. Seamlessly managed these events in locations such as, The International Convention Centre of Sydney, Globe of Stockholm, Mariinsky Theatre in St. Petersburg. 

>> Develop strategic partnership between Global Advisory Board, formed by C-level executives, and external stakeholders to develop engagement programs, embedding alumni insights into every project. Projects included updating database, developing an all-in-one community management platform, and raising awareness on social responsibility and thought leadership.
profile_positions.title: Alumni Relations Officer

company.name: CEMS Global Alliance in Management Education Alumni Association

profile_positions.description:
Supported the Executive Director, in charge of creating meaningful opportunities for alumni, students, academic members and corporate partners, on a daily basis to assess needs and requests from customers living in 75+ countries, over 100 different nationalities (Year-on-Year community growth of 15%). 
Responsibilities included facilitate communication, operation supports, planning and preparation of meeting agenda, material & minutes, and working with over 250 volunteers in 40 countries for network outreach, community building, and partnership with external stakeholders.  

>> Supported planning and execution of 250+ global and local events each year, handled advertisement, created marketing collaterals, planned logistics, and managed partner/ sponsorship for joint events with Corporate Partners such as ABB, Google, Henkel, and McKinsey & Company.

>> Achieved online engagement growth from 30% to 75% by planning and implementing omni-channel, digital strategy in marketing and communication. Improved email campaigns, monthly newsletters, and developed over 100 social media communities on Facebook and LinkedIn in over 40 countries. 

>>Increased stakeholder engagement by 121% ( in number of Local Chapters presence), by 186% in number of volunteers to enable ground support and create lifelong connection.

>>Co-developed a new strategy to unlock unexplored value of initiatives, events and services by conducting market research and data analytics to identify needs and user experience of different stakeholders.
profile_positions.title: Program Manager- Events, Marketing and Community

profile_positions.description:
Supported financial activities ranging from updating invoices to writing annual budget and reports. Administered databases for payments, revenues, and automated membership payment  

>> Settled financial reports dated back to 10+ years, reduced 80% of outstanding receivables, and established professional audit process with PwC.
>> Increased annual membership payment by 30%.
profile_positions.title: Assistant to Finance Director

profile_positions.description:
